author: cnbc.com
title: QAD: Fiscal 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
SANTA BARBARA, Calif. (AP) _ QAD Inc. (QADA) on Wednesday reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $1.4 million, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the Santa Barbara, California-based company said it had net income of 7 cents. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 15 cents per share.
The enterprise software developer posted revenue of $86.2 million in the period.
For the current quarter ending in August, QAD said it expects revenue in the range of $82 million to $83 million.
The company expects full-year revenue in the range of $328 million to $332 million.
QAD shares have risen 21 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $47.20, a climb of 46 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on QADA at https://www.zacks.com/ap/QADA
